availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Winn (Louisville, Kentucky, brick mason and captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, bricklayer, mason, and soldier. Native of Ireland. Married to Julia Ann King Winn in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on July 31, 1853. Father of James Winn and Georgeanna Winn. Bricklayer in Louisville in 1860. Mason in Louisville in 1861. Served in the Provost Guard of Louisville as a sergeant from October 19, 1861, to September 3, 1862. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from November 24, 1862, through March 1863. Served in the Second Regiment of the Louisville Legion of Defense as captain in 1863.
